name: Alakazam

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.

strengths: Damage Swap allows unlimited damage redistribution per turn
Can keep key Pokemon alive by moving damage away
Excellent synergy with high-HP Pokemon like Chansey
weaknesses: 80 HP is relatively low for a Stage 2
Psychic weakness is problematic against Mewtwo
Attack is underwhelming at 30 damage for 3 energy
synergies: Chansey - High HP tank to absorb moved damage
Pokemon Center - Heal all damage from Pokemon with no energy
Mr. Mime - Invisible Wall blocks big attacks
Scoop Up - Remove heavily damaged Pokemon entirely
counters: Gust of Wind - Force Alakazam active before ready

competitiveHistory: Alakazam was a cornerstone of the famous 'Damage Swap' archetype, one of the most iconic decks in early Pokemon TCG. Combined with Chansey and Pokemon Center, players could effectively heal all damage each turn while slowly whittling down opponents. The deck required skill to pilot but was highly competitive.

rulings.ruling: You may use Damage Swap as many times as you like during your turn, as long as you don't Knock Out any of your Pokemon.
You cannot move a damage counter to a Pokemon if it would Knock Out that Pokemon.
Damage Swap moves damage counters, not damage. This distinction matters for some card effects.
If Alakazam becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed, you cannot use Damage Swap until those conditions are removed.
